I was working on a literature review for my research class back in college. I needed to make a really wide table to summarize my results in the ACM LaTeX template. Was I using a single-column LaTeX document, it would‚Äôve been straight forward, but this was a double-column document which brought a challenge.

Chances are you‚Äôd want to create a wide table in a double-column LaTeX document, and if you use the regular code for a table in LaTeX you end up with something like this:

After some googling, you‚Äôd find this good answer on stackoverflow and get this:

When what you really want is something like this:

To get the really wide table (above) to fit on the page over both columns, you‚Äôre going to resize it. The only caveat is that your font sizes will be smaller, which isn‚Äôt too much of a problem.

The final code looks like this:


% import the adjustbox package at the top of your document
\usepackage{adjustbox}

\begin{table*}[ht]
    \caption{Table Caption}
    \centering
    % wrap the tabular element in a resizebox 
    \resizebox{\linewidth}{!}{
        \begin{tabular}{ |l|l|l|l|l|l|l|l| } 
            % 
            % table contents go in here
            % 
        \end{tabular}
    }
\end{table*}
